intro: Sparganophorus fuscatus, commonly known as the black spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive flower structures. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has simple, alternate leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by specialized bracts. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
